content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
 ENG REVIEW(NOT REVELANT)  Review updated! 02.05.16 Is there a lot of games of drifting on a pc?-NO!Being a big fan of the drift culture, I really liked this game,The game is already very playable! Positive things: -Support for mods-Track editor-Each engine has its own sound-Good music-NotBad physics (physics Corrected, it is difficult to drift, now I feel like a cow on ice)-Ability to swap engines (Where you still saw it on the PC except in the old good SLRR?)-Balancing car-Engine tuning-Adjusting camber, eversion of the wheels and the offset of wheels-A good number of cars (or Rather 22 which as for me is enough)-External tuning (Wheels, Wheels Painting, body Painting, body Kits (Body kits are available on Silvia 13, Hachiroku,14 Silvia and Mark 90 only))-Multiplayer (Separate servers to 16 slots, It is also possible to create your own server) Defects: -Unity Engine-Few maps (8)-Civic, what he is doing here, he is front-wheel drive? OO-Not very comfortable speedometer (IMHO) All What I would like to see in the game:	-Toyota Chaser-BMW E30-BMW E34-BMW E39-Painting of individual parts of the car in your color-Ability to put different wheels on the front and the rear of the car-The size adjustment of the speedometerThat's AllP.S. My English isn't so good, You can report about mistakes in the review on my wall :3 For all your questions about the game I will answer on the wall in the STEAM, so make sure that it is open to ABSOLUTELY EVERYONE  RUS REVIEW(НЕ АКТУАЛЬНО, Я ЛЕНИВАЯ ЗАДНИЦА, СКОРО	 КОГДА-НИБУДЬ ОБНОВЛЮ ОБЗОР)  Обзор обновлен! 02.05.16г	Много ли есть игр про дрифт на pc?-НЕТ!Являясь ярым фаном дрифт культуры, мне очень приглянулась данная игра,Игра сырая, но уже очень играбельна! Плюсы:	-Поддержка модов-Редактор треков-Завезли графончик, на 20.04.16г графон еще немного подтянули-Почти у каждого двигателя свой звук -Частые обновления	 Частыми обновлениями нас перестали радовать :с-Неплохое музыкальное сопровождение-Неплохая физика (Поправили физику, сложно дрифтить, теперь чувствую себя коровой на льду)-Возможность свапа двигателей (Где вы еще это видели на PC кроме как в старом добром SLRR?)-Балансировка авто-Тюнинг двигателя-Регулировка выворота, развала и вылета колес-Хорошее количество авто (А если точнее 22 чего как по мне вполне хватает)-Внешний тюнинг (Литье, Покраска литья, Покраска кузова, Обвесы (Пока только на Сливу 13, на Хачироку,14 Сливу и Марк 90 который я так ждал))-Мультиплеер (Появились отдельные сервера на 16 слотов, соответственно появилась возможность создать такой сервер) Минусы:	-Движок (Никогда не любил юнити)-Мало карт (Всего 8) -Мультиплеер (Почему мультиплеер и в плюсах и в минусах? Потому что он плохо реализован, кто играл тот поймет, но его присутствие это явный плюс)	 -Mark II...ПОЧЕМУ ИМЕННО СОТКА?! ДАЙТЕ НАМ НАШ ДЕВЯНОСТИК! А ЕЩЕ НУЖЕН ЧАЙЗЕР!	-Сивик, что он тут вообще делает он же переднеприводный? Оо -Слишком большой	 Неудобный спидометр (ИМХО) -Иногда камера ведет себя неадекватно  Камеру поправили То что хотел бы видеть в игре:	 -Оптимизацию))0)))000))		 -Mark II JZX90	-Chaser JZX90-BMW E30-BMW E34-BMW E39 -Nissan Silvia S14 (Ранее покоривший мое сердце)	-Покраску отдельных частей авто в свой цвет-Полный тюнинг авто как внутренний так и внешний-Возможность ставить разные диски на переднюю и заднюю часть авто (возможно я один такой извращенец))0)))000)))-Регулировку размера спидометра -Ну и возможность создавать лобби для игры только с друзями(Возможно такое уже есть просто я этого не знаю)	Вроде бы все.P.S. Знаю что Д0XY9| хочу но всеже) На все заданые вопросы под обзором, отвечаю вам на стену в стиме, так что убедитесь что она открыта АБСОЛЮТНО ВСЕМ для комментирования!	Игру рекомендую всем!

content:
Posted: April 19, 2016
												UPDATE v2 AS OF THIS POST I WAS PERMANENTLY BANNED FROM THE DSJ FORUMS FOR REVEALING THIS INFO BY JDM HIMSELFhttp://puu.sh/ooDLr/88d0b2461d.pnghttp://puu.sh/ooDLr/88d0b2461d.pnghttp://puu.sh/ooDLr/88d0b2461d.pngUPDATE: THE GRAPHICS UPDATE AND *NEW PHYSICS* AND "TOUGE" MAP ARE ALL JANKUM.THE MAP IS STOLEN FROM ASSETTO CORSA, THE GRAPHICS UPDATE IS HIGHER RESOLUTION TEXTURES STOLEN FROM A DIFFERENT GAME ENGINE WITH CRANKED REFLECTIONS AND THE PHYSICS ARE THE LEAST FLUID OF ALL THE UPDATES AND MAKE IT FEEL LIKE A DSJ RIP-OFF IF THAT WERE EVEN POSSIBLE0/10 IGN - Who the ♥♥♥♥ made this pile of ♥♥♥♥?0/5 GameSpot - Worst waste of 7 dollars since that time I tried meth1/10 NextGenTactics - Polished Turd.I've been one of the biggest initial supporters of this game, and I was one of the people to help it thrive as much as it did. I can say that it was once a good game, but due to recent updates and recent events I no longer support the creator or the game.Drifting physics and controller support got very glitchy as of the miata addition, (A car that has been in the game files from day 1 wouldn't break the game)I was forum banned for no proper reason, see here; https://steamcommunity.com/app/412880/discussions/0/412449508291314237/JDM - Games creator says "Ignore people like modnar" do you agree?I digress there, relevant info to the game hereThe handling and controls are rather intuitive and easy for people to catch on early, however they become a problem and an annoyance down the road as it prevents you from controlling your car 100%, and they fight you in a similar fashion to nfs 2016's controls.The car list would be more impressive if all of the cars hitboxes and horsepower capabilities weren't all the same, the only differences in the cars being I believe there's 1 FWD mixed in, look out.Oh, and transmission gearings kind of make them different in-game SOMETIMES so that counts for something.All of the car models are blatantly ripped off from other games, notice how the models are flipped now? And on top of that the real car names were even used, remnants of this exist in the files and you can see it in regedit as well if not on the badges on the cars themselves.The "body kits" update was okay, the rim update was lackluster but I didn't complain. The steady stream of new maps, cars, and general content was good for the first month or so.Until people began to abuse broken code, change colours and glitch it out to the extent it would leave assorted coloured bubbles on your screen on the lens flare and other shadows and reflections about the map effectively making it impossible to play, gross impossible cambers, the disabling of collision (and they can still throw you around without collision too!) and addition of thousands of horsepower to ones vehicle.And then the updates halted, only to be seen once every 2-3 weeks with the addition of broken code and features that didn't really do anything. People began to quit, certain issues made the game unplayable for some and too difficult to figure out for others. This is where I came in, if people had problems, they came to me. I had over 100 players at any given time from DSJ on my list, and I couldn't go an hour without helping someone with something DSJ related whether it be in a private message on steam, or one of the hundreds of forum posts and threads on the official game or steam forums separately (Lots of em)I got people together for big drift events, did a ton of recordings with the community, and just rallied together support for it and hyped up every little update despite the circumstances while still running FREE tech support (the updates ♥♥♥♥ing sucked and were broken, look you can tell)Still JDM refuses to address the big bugs and it's been almost a month, if not so already since he broke the game in a bad way. He claims to have all this work done, well let's see it. You rolled out new content like it was a fancy carpet at first, what happened?TL:DR; I helped fix controllers and peoples games, and I got forum banned, all posts deleted and im :steamsalty:Used to be a really good game with a lot of potential until russian updates

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												First of all, let me preface this review by declaring that racing games are not my strength or favorite and I am an imbecile when it comes to car mechanics & terminology. I can barely change the oil in my own car so when it comes or horsepower, torque etc... I am clueless.With all that being said I actually enjoyed this game much more than I thought I would!While I found myself dead last in most of the races it was still fun. Controls were easier to pick up than I was anticipating and I was drifting in no time. As you would expect, there is an emphasis on drift mechanics with scoring multiplyers applied on how well you do it.Graphics are good with crisp, sharp outlines to the vehicles.The only drawbacks for me subpar audio/music and the lack of useful in-game settings menu.Was a fun ride but I'll stick to my strengths. Recommended for those into the racing genre.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												PROOF ONE OF THE TOUGE MAPS IS STOLEN: http://assettocorsa.club/mods/tracks/akina-downhill.html Does this look familiar?[SERIOUS REVIEW ABOUT THE GAME AND ITS HISTORY. TL;DR AT BOTTOM.]This game used to be great, it had so much potential. Infact my original review stated "The best $7 you would ever spend"DSJ was first getting off the ground, people were doing lets plays of it. JDM4iK suddenly had a way bigger follower base on the game.At the time, the game had great physics and a lot going for it. It was recieving regular updates with original content. It all went downhill from there.There was an MX-5 model in the game, and it was ready for release. It wasn't released until several updates later. Before that, there was: A track being changed into day, a multiplayer system, and chat.Ever since the chat system came out, it got worse. People were doing drag races, and blocking roads. Multiplayer got boring. Less updates were happening, less news was coming out.There was a physics update which made drifting a lot harder and a lot less realistic. The MX-5 update came out, with even more broken physics than before.As of this post, the update simply stole a map from Assetto Corsa and made physics unuseable.During the course of all of this, the community wasn't listened to one bit, and was permabanned for trying to speak up about all this going on.Before, I would have said you should buy this game. Now? I think it's just not worth it anymore.3/10. Stolen content, very broken physics, most of the real players have given up on the game.TL;DR: This game used to be the best driving game ever. Now it's just some horribly designed mashup of stolen maps and models. The community isn't listened to, and when someone points out something bad they get permabanned from everything.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												I want to, but I can't reccomend Drift Streets Japan. It has nice car models. It has beautiful touge maps. But it's not fun to play. The physics can work but they feel...strange more often than not and the progression is ungodly slow with few things to break up the monotony. It's not 'realistic' enough to be a simulator but it's also trying to avoid being 'arcade' and doesn't really accomplish much.The options for graphics, gameplay, and controls are poor. This game looked a lot funner when it was released. I decided to give it some time to bake before picking it up in a sale, and I guess it baked too long and got burned. I hope one day it's nice again. I will change my review if that becomes a thing.I do really like the touge maps though. I was just hoping for something a little more like a modern IDAS.

												A good time waster for fairly cheap for someone who is into the japanese car community.+Game is getting updated very often (update every 2 days)+Car performance leveling/upgrading+Car power graphs+Adjustment of camber/offset tires-Broken/very horrible brakes-Cars are too slidey-The slightest collision with anything will end your point streak(even the ground!)+/- Multiplayer, but only one map. content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												Every positive review is either a lie or by someone with absolutely no taste in games.  The gameplay and controls are garbage.  Gameplay consits of tapping left and right to slide about in the most simple way, you don't actually control the car just suggest which direction you want your car to spin, you don't have to touch the brakes ever and the car countersteers for you.  Braking will cause your car to actually lift into the air, never in a game have I seen a one ton car pull a stoppie.  Also, going around a corner is nigh impossible because of these problems if you're going more than 20kph(thats 12mph).  Also toss in the horrible graphical glitching that seems to occur constantly I just dont get why this has such a high rating.  Avoid.

number of helpful: 29 of 48 people (60%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												No brakes simulator 2016.Bad-Physics suck out loud. Tap a wall? Welcome to NASA.-If your drifting try and use the e-brake or reg brake they always seems to instantly make the car go straight but not do anything to slow you down. -At speed the car basically refuses to turn.-It's been said in other reviews but no engine braking/ car stays at the same speed even off the gas. -Tracks look and feel like crap. overly bumpy. Kind of like all the terrain is made from flat pieces stacked and rotated. -Keeping the car sideways is basically a tap left and right game. -If it matters to you, your basically ghost riding. No driver in the car. (the steering wheel does turn tho!)-Other then color of the car and rims you can't do anything else to your car. The car tunning is basically camber. You can go stock or full retard both positive and negitive. -Buying an engine swap that comes OEM with a turbo doesn't give you a turbo to start with and engine levels are lower than what they produce in real life. -Mods are pretty basic. Block, head, pistons, intake, exhuast, ecu, turbo and nitrous.-Controller support is a lie. If mines plugged in the car just revs. Can't even switch to keyboard without a restart. -No control map or even a way to view controls. But if you've played NFS carbon the controls are about the same. -Stupidly small detail but your head lights work great! But your tail lights only work when you press the brake.-The money system is pretty simple/odd. No challenges or missions or anything to get money. 10k points = 100 bucks. Good.-Mad skids yo. Not really. I lied.-Cars don't actually look to bad. -in car view/ cockpit view.-Devs seem to be active. More tracks then the game originally launched with already.-Engine swaps. RB26 <3-Steady FPS.Weird? I guess.If you use the latest AMD drivers you may have odd graphical errors. When in the upgrade section the power gains for parts only show as the charts sliding over then aren't visible. But we all know AMD drivers suck. Pretty sure the games an ISO / Andorid port. I'm sure if I bothered to look into it I'd find it on the play store. At this time it's not really worth buying. But active devs, so hopefully all the issues will get sorted soon. But right now the games more annoying than fun. Sorry for the messy review. I hate writing them.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
Product received for free
												Drift Streets Japan is a Drift Simulator/Arcade Racer developed by JDM4iK. The game features various cars and customization for the cars, and to progress you need to drift to earn money.Pros:-Cars models, customization are well detailed for an indie game-Tracks are wonderful, and the track editor makes it possible for players to create even better tracks-Music and sound effects are good and clear.Cons:-Physics feels a bit clunky, it's hard to drift and keep a drift going. Cars have too much traction once you start, but as soon as you go sideways, there is almost no control of the car-Game doesn't really have an objective, you purchase a car, customize it and drift to earn more money to buy more cars and customizationsOverall, this is fun for casual players who just need something to waste time, but based on the physics and non-existent objectives, I can't really recommend it.5/10

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												Might have only played at least 1.4 hours on the game, but the gameplay mechanics, and the graphics are amazing, and not to mention you can drift cars. Which is amazing! The game will roughly cost you about £4.99, which I think is a reasonable price for a game like this, but I would like to see more cars, more maps, and more tuning added in the future. If you haven't gotten this game already I recommend you go out, and buy it (If you like cars, and drifting of course.) I would also like to see private servers to play with friends, because when you are online with people they sometimes accidently hit you. Yes this can happen on the private servers to, but in the end you can at least skype your friends, and tell them to go on at a time. I would rate this game 10/10, just because it has potential for the future, and I like cars, and drifting. Upate: The game is normally getting updated every 2 days! Which is some amazing work by the dev's of th game, and or the dev of the game! :)

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												It's actually pretty good!  Graphics, physics, it's all here, it's the perfect game!  Or well, part of a game.  It's far from done.  Developer, PLEASE put up an early access banner.  There's no way this is a finished product.  There's no races, events, it doesn't even keep track of anything besides money.  You just slide around in short maps and that's the whole game.  Please, create us new cars, maps, and more things to do!  It's pretty barren right now!  


YouTube™ Video: Let's play Drift Streets Japan (PC game on Steam) by JDM4iK 1080p 60fps 

			Views: 14,301		

			Be sure to check out part 2 of this video here since there are some new things added to the game! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hI-e0iUYMkA New street racing game! Or part of a game anyway!		

Oh and I see another reviewer stated that the dev is giving out free keys for shill reviews.  I wish I had known!  lol I paid for mine.  http://i.imgur.com/msrcPNs.png  I always like to support indie racing games that are $5-6 brand new.  I am very impressed at this one.  But don't expect more than a slide around simulator.  It's not a whole game.  Oh, and there's no Toyota Supra.EDIT 2016-01-04: There IS a Toyota Supra, now!  Also there are four maps.  And online multiplayer, and controller support.  This developer is patching the game several times per day with huge changes.  It's surely in active development, but the least he could do is put up the Early Access banner.  My frames per second in multiplayer is absolutely horrible.  Maybe in a couple days he can figure that out.  And the controller doesn't work properly, but it was not a feature that previously existed.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
												Drift Streets Japan is a racing game what based at the drifting.In this game is a gameplay is simple enough, at the start you got a some cash, so you should buy a car and ... start drifting! Well at the start I a bit afraided, because the drifting in racing games not my strong side, i never liked drifting tasks in NFS and other games, but this game is surprised me. Drifting here is enough simple, controls are good, so its shouldn't make for you any trouble. In a game you will found a lot of cars what you can buy them if you have enough money, also the customization is very good, the game have enough deep tuning system. The money for tuning or new cars you can earn by drifting, because when you do this you earn points, for example if you earn 70000 points, its equal to 700 dollar.Also in this game you will found a enough maps, track editor, coop and multiplayer feature. The game music is good, well complements the game feeling. The graphic looks very nice, the cars are really has a realistic view.So my verdict+nice graphic+nice music+easy controls+good customization+track editor+multiplayer-no trading cads and steam achievements-"only" drift maybe can be repetitive Well this game is looks interesting, however there you should only drift its also can bring for you a lot of fun, because this game have a lot of cars, good customization and multiplayer too. So i think if you like racing games you should try this one, especially if its got a good discount. 7/10

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Even with updates still feels like a mobile game ported to steam, game is not like other racing simulators on the consoles such as frza and Gran Turismo as far as handling and gripping.Its fun to hop on and do a couple drifts around the track and hop off I honestly do a few 360 drift entries and a lap or two and hop off within 10 mins. Its great for an arcade style of drifting somewhat of how the Need for Speed series is as its not as serious or simulator like for drifting. The brake and hand brake can be glitchy as the creator behind the game tends to mess with it between updates. Feels like the game will be one day abandoned as he is focused on many projects all at once including new ones. It was nice when we had a lobby for many ppl to join and not be restricted to 12/16 but in the end this was a free mobile game ported to steam which i notice costs more than the 6.99 i originally paid. The game lacks real courses has a few cars that are nice to drift with, would be solid if the game had a 1st and 2nd gen rx7.Seems like the courses could be further refines and the track editor is very limiting also you cannot share the track editor online. Customization on the cars is mediocre while the game features a 93 honda civic hatch back with upgrading/swapping a rear wheel drive motor the car still stays front wheel drive making it the only car that can grip in the game. None of the other cars are grippy for grip racing as the game is set up for only drifting. I would recommend it if your a fan of drifitng but i would not pay the current cost of what is being asked for now. Seems like there is a big chance for this game to be abandoned in 2017+ with the mobile need for speed like features.Pros 73 skyline, ae87, fd3s, gtr skyline, 240sx, and japanese carsQuick arcade like drift style good for small amounts of time for boredom Backwards entry, 360 entry, drift point combo multiplyer Quick to pick up if you are used to drifitng on gamesConsDevelopement of levelsMultiplayer limited to 12/16 players " was unlimited at one point then there was a 64 slot server room later removed "Akina level is very glitchyTrack editor is limited with little features to use / no capabilities to upload online to shareSometimes upgrades may make your car feel grippier than beforeneeds more refine with controls and more design in levelsBland level designMain menu is simple very mobile game likeHonda civic in a drifting game.... Not even the rare 4wd model, with motor swap civic stays fwd :(Needs a 1st and 2nd gen rx7, 73 celica, mr2, mazda cosmo, nissan fairlady z 91, silvia s13, s14, levin corolla or ae86 coupe corolla, mitsubishi evolution any model any other japanese classic would be nice. Controller support can be hit or miss on some people

content:
Posted: December 23, 2016
Product received for free
Title: Drift Streets JapanGenre: Multiplayer, Racing, SimulationDeveloper: JDM4iK Publisher: JDM4iK Release Date: 21 Dec, 2015Introduction: A car enthusiast would be drawn straight to this game, with the positive reviews and mechanics that are said to be the most realistic, and I can say that indeed they are. As soon as I launched the game, the first thing I noticed was that it was not going to be a walk in the park, you could feel the lost of traction as you were spinning out of control after every corner, making it quite heart-racing along side a cliff. Although it will seem hard at first, after a few hours of gameplay, you start to get the hang of it. The customisation is also very thought out, with buying new cars to fine tuning the engine, it really makes you think how to spend your money!Pros: - Hours of fun to be had.- Lots of customisation.- Extremely realistic physics and mechanics.- A reliable developer.Cons:- May be stressful at times.- Are a few bugs. (not game-breaking)- Can yet again become repetitive.Final Thoughts: Overall, this game is perfect for car enthusiasts looking for a bit of fun whilst still having realistic physics & mechanics. You can also hook up a wheel to your computer for the perfect experience.Personal Rating: 8.5/10Thank you for reading through!

content:
Posted: January 26
												Drift Streets Japan is an illegal street racing game. It's actually a very  good game. What is better than drifting all around Japan. I've always loved tuned cars since I was a kid. I've played many racing games and this game ain't on the top of the list nor in the bottom.The soundtrack is super awesome. Trap and Drift is just perfect. The sound FX is good. The engines sometimes sound strange but everything else is good.The graphics are quite good. The textures are good. The cars, the tracks and the surroundings are detailed. The game's physics is great.The gameplay is very easy. You get used to it in few seconds. The arrows or WASD for movements, Space for Hand breaks, X for clutch, Shift and Ctrl for Shifting, F for repair and C to change the camera. It support Gamepad and Steering wheels well you gotta do some stuff first but it will work out. You can't use the keyboard outside the track which is kinda annoying.The multiplayer is impressive it's really fun to play with you friends. There are lots of cars they all are Japanese tho. C'mon you can't imagine yourself drifting in an Actros SLT oh wait that's a different game.There are eight tracks. They are perfect for Drifting, Driving and Sightseeing.There are lots of ways to tune and modify your car's performance. There ain't many body modifications. Sorry RICERs this ain't a game for you lol.Earning money ain't hard cough in a legit way cough.There ain't a driver so it kinda feels weird at first the same as Burn out Paradise.The cockpit camera is also good but no hands on the wheel <.<If you decreased height of your car it glitches while driving.Changing the colors is also sucks you  need to click ∞ click to find the color you are looking for.It supposed to be an illegal street racing game but there ain't ant cops.There is only options for Audio and video settings. Needs options for key bindings changing the games files is a pain.The game is definitely great. The price is kinda low lol that makes it even better. If you play only in single player mode you will get bored fast so make sure to play with others.I loved it. And I recommend it.If you are interested in reading and discussing reviews. Check Cassus.org

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												Bought this game (for $8AUD) entirely due to the fact that the promo image contained my real life car (s15), unfortunately the game as of now does not contain a s15 *insert sad face*. Is it worth 8AUD? No. Do i regret buying it? No. *DO NOT LET THE IPHONE STYLE GRAPHICS SWAY YOUR DECISION* the game is extremely addicting particularly due to the drifting physics (Great compared to most simulators, can be a tad better), the inbuilt jukebox(Trap junkies will love it) and the combination of sound effects within each vehicle, Bov's and dose pipes (quite pleasantly) sound exactly as they should in real life and provide me with a sense of immaturity where i build boost and let off the throttle (as i do in real life (; ) resulting with the tickling of my nuts as the glorious sounds of zuTUTUTU222tototo is released. Engine sounds within this game also seem to have been provided effort (SR20s sound like SR20s!!!).in conclusion, if your a car enthusiast (particularly JDM) and you have the money to spare, buy this game to prove to your mates that your not a♥♥♥♥♥♥c-u-nt at drifting as they have called you IRL and redeem your self from the humility you recieved as the sl00ty Gangas and elderly pensioners give you the little finger as you one wheel peel your open diff na sh!tbox around the local Maccas CarPark. *Note to car enthusiasts i believe the R34 is a 25gt-t not a GT-R as seen with the z-tune bodykit hence the RB25 in the car specs tab (makes sense right, drifting game = rwd). Basically think of it as a♥♥♥♥♥♥kient who couldnt afford a GTR but wanted the ganga next door to give him the gobby of his life as her moot quivers in fear whilst in the presence of that fibreglass infested replica virginity taker within his drive way.also if the developer sees this, more tracks (figure 8 plz), more cars like my s15 and ai vehicles could be a little faster and less stupid (like that van who crashes into another van and keeps driving with the van on top of it.)TY TY.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
												-- THIS IS NOT A FANBOY REVIEW -- So I'm going to lists some pros and cons so far into my gaming experience.PROS:+Japanese import cars+PS4 remote compatible( I use Pinnacle Game Profiler ) +The turbo spools+Some drift tracks are okay+The aftermarket parts are cheap+It's easy to make money just by drifting+They have a Toyota Chaser dammit, other game industries should learn from this+Interior is not bad at all, just need minor touching here and there+When in interior mode the driver moves his head left and right when in drift mode and is not stiff.+You can adjust the camber and offset of your car+Music is alright, the list should be more at least but it has potential.+They have mods which is nice ( My favs: Ebisu, Tsukuba etc )+Community is good+Dat price thoCONS:-The car lists can should be more considering some of these cars aren't even licensed. -You hit a wall and your car goes flying in the air like it's zero gravity. -You hit a wall slightly (like a small wall tap) and all of your points is gone.-I don't know what's up with the recent update but the frames are like 14fps on max settings-Some of the cars sound like vacuum cleaner which should be polished a tad bit or at least mess aroundwith the sound editing ( Not the 1JZ it sounds great )-The tracks should be polished a bit as well, there's some invisible walls sticking out on Drift Track 1-There's hackers which needs to be dealt with seriously.-No customization parts for the exterior or interior of the car or able to remove front bumper to expose intercooler.-No neons or strobes which is a bit sad honestly-No in-game vinyls such as itasha, tribal, real life car designs etc-No workshop for this game...like how can you not.-Can barely do a tandem or drift train with somebody without their car lagging back towards you causing it to hit you and then you lose all of your points and everyone elses.-No steam trading cards or achievementsThat's about it honestly. I somewhat recommend this game but it does need a polish on a few areas listed above since there's too many fanboysoverhyping this game. Overall score: 7/10It's not a AAA title like Gran Turismo but it does have potential to fill in the blank spaces GT has left behind on the drift scene that it was capable of.Official review of TeamA99E Drift Warriors -  ドリフト・ウォリアズ

content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
												All of these are rated on a scale of 1-10, 10 being best and 1 being worst.Game play: 7/10 The gameplay takes some getting used to, but when you get the handling down the drifting is fun and the car mods are fun too, although drifting feels like it's on ice.Graphics: 6/10 The graphics are decent, except for cockpit view.Story: N/AMultiplayer Experience: 10/10 This game's community is small, I won't lie about that. But, the community on this game is one of the best communities on any game I've ever played. They're willing to tandem, drag, train, and help you on a moments notice. It is some serious fun.Single player Experience: 8/10 Think multiplayer mode without the people. It gets repetitive.Overall (Average): 7.75/10 This game has a lot of potential and is already a decent game. Some of the best fun you can have for 7 bucks. The devs regularly update it with new content and features. Oh, there's also a track editor, so there goes even more hours of your life.

												- Good selection of cars.- has a Toyota Chaser/JZX100.- Turbo flutter- A metric F*** ton of negative camber.- Engine swaps and preformance mods. Cons:- Audio could be better.- Random frame drops.- teleporting glitch on Akina.- Lack of car body mods.- Down shifting is a bit odd.Meh:- Rfactor style grahpics, meaning cars have decent res on the outside but the tracks don't.- Controller support is messed up.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												I really want to like this game, but in it's current state.I really cant say I do.1: Lack of content, it's pretty much a paid for early access pre-alpha advertised as a full game, I thought something was odd when it's a 3D game application and the total size was 300mb. I was right.2: Mechanics are incomplete, the physics are off to a nice start, however they are not finished and the braking mechanics are really broken.3: Performance issues dispite having very simple graphics, including little to no foliage and little to no traffic the performance is surprisingly bad.4: Game is themed in Japan but there is no Japanese music or Japanese themed music.Infact the general mastered quality of the soundtrack is prodigiously bad, which is unfortunate when music is so critical to driving immersion.5: Multiplayer is broken, maximum capcity as of this review is 100 players online in 1 server.It does have lan support, if your into Lan parties.If you've an interest in this title, I would advise you wait, add it to your following and see how it develops.Otherwise you will probably be dissappointed if you try it as is.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
												This game is fun, however know that it is NOT finished. Besides this updates are being rolled out every day it seems and the game has improved dramatically since it's release. There are a few features I would like to see implimented into the game such as a chat box, players have no way of communicating with each other. Secondly there needs to be some sort of private lobby support, so you can play with your friends without running into other people online. Many people playing in Akina want to twin drift up and down the mountain however you're constantly crashing into other players.Thirdly the crash/bump physics need to be greatly improved, when you bump a barrier or another car you completely stop in your tracks, these pysics are and unrealistic just generally annoying to play with. Another thing I would like to add is the multiplayer needs some optimization, from your point of view other players cars are jumping around everywhere and overall look very buggy.Aside from the negaives this game is getting better everyday and I hope the developers stay focused and listen to their community to make this a great game.

Pros: Good car physics, Realistic CAR textures; Great amount of cars; Good tracks to start with; Good car setup; Multiplayer and Lan features; The steering is great if you are a beginner because it helps you with counter steer; A̶l̶m̶o̶s̶t̶ full wheel and pedals compatibility;Cons: S̶o̶u̶n̶d̶ ̶e̶r̶r̶o̶r̶s̶ ̶w̶h̶e̶n̶ ̶p̶l̶a̶y̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶i̶n̶ ̶m̶u̶l̶t̶i̶p̶l̶a̶y̶e̶r̶ (Fixed); L̶a̶g̶ ̶o̶n̶ ̶m̶u̶l̶t̶i̶p̶l̶a̶y̶e̶r̶(Almost fixed); L̶a̶c̶k̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶d̶e̶t̶a̶i̶l̶s̶ ̶i̶n̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶e̶n̶v̶i̶r̶o̶n̶m̶e̶n̶t̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶t̶r̶a̶c̶k̶s̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶a̶l̶s̶o̶ ̶s̶o̶m̶e̶ ̶b̶u̶g̶s̶ (Fixed); As I said the steering is great for beginners , but it's annoying if you want to "step up", for instance, if you want to make "donuts" the wheels are constantly turning to the opposite side making impossible keep the control of the car.Expected to see in future: At my point of view, it MUST be a option to deactivate the auto counter steer. It will be very useful; Car liveries; More customization features (Change rims, spoilers, body kits, more advanced suspension tuning, etc...); O̶n̶l̶i̶n̶e̶ ̶l̶o̶b̶y̶ ̶s̶e̶l̶e̶c̶t̶o̶r̶(Done :) );Final thoughts:Overall it's a good game.It's true that this game is still in development but come on!!!It's only 6$!!Some peple are complaining that this game is expensive and it's missing a lot o things, but keep in mind that you will not find the same thing on a 6$ game that you will find in a 50$ game!In my opinion the game is getting better and better with the regular updates and, in my point of view, is the best drifting game that I have played, or at least that I remember.Developers please continue your great job!

content:

Product received for free
												TL:DR - This game ♥♥♥♥ing sucks and you all know it.I didn't really enjoy the game to an extent. I've heard that people praised for its previous versions because of the old physics. But even with that,I still won't recommend it. It looks outdated,the effects were eye-gouching. The camera placement is hindering gameplay rather than helping you see what's in front of you. Especially in narrower maps like Akina,where every corners look as miniscule as a bag of♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Modding wasn't very intuitive and sometimes the forum don't look as active as it could've been.Would I say it's the worst I've played? No. - It's just flawed in so many ways,I've played it for a couple of hours in this game with friends just to bash about how terrible it is. It could be improved,I've already seen some people trying to mod this game,and that's great for them. If you look at this game in a value standpoint,it's a no-no at that. Then again,if the developer actually tries to make the game better,sure. I'll play it again.

												I'm going to be honest here. This game is not good. They physics are abismal, the sound cuts in and out online, controller support is nonexistant, and the point system is glitchy (you lose point on impact with anything, and i mean anything). The maps are poor quality, like relatable to need for speed underground, the first one from 2003! The only real redeaming factor for me is the fact I can mod it REALLY easily and make straight up joke cars. For god sake, I made a s2000 swapped with a 2jz that had so much power the number was an exponent! XD I really wouldnt recomend this game to anyone being I don't think its worth what you pay for. If it was free or under $4 then maybe. But NOT worth $7. TLDR: really not good, except as a joke when you mod it.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Drift Streets Japan is not the best car game i have played in a long shot. Yes its the only game like this on steam, and yes the drift physics are decent. But the game isn't perfect. Sure you many say for $6 its pretty cheap, and it is. But is it worth buying?To answer that in short : Yes, i think it is. I bought the game when it first came out, and back then lets be honest the game was missing ALOT, but after a week or so after release, the game has been updated quite a few times, always adding new and improved things. Such as manual transmission, more cars, a better interior, and much more. Yes, of course it could use alot of work, with the many bugs, and being able to use a controller, but if you look past that, and see that is has a chance to become something great, it makes you wonder why you shouldn't buy it. I do have high hopes for this game, as it has already come so far, and i do believe the dev's have some idea as to what they want to add.In short, i think Drift Streets Japan is great game to pick up. Yes, it has bugs and glitches, but what game doesn't? and what game on steam allows to buy drift like this game does? NOTHING.Hense why i recommend this game.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Drift Streets Japan is not the best car game i have played in a long shot. Yes its the only game like this on steam, and yes the drift physics are decent. But the game isn't perfect. Sure you many say for $6 its pretty cheap, and it is. But is it worth buying?To answer that in short : Yes, i think it is. I bought the game when it first came out, and back then lets be honest the game was missing ALOT, but after a week or so after release, the game has been updated quite a few times, always adding new and improved things. Such as manual transmission, more cars, a better interior, and much more. Yes, of course it could use alot of work, with the many bugs, and being able to use a controller, but if you look past that, and see that is has a chance to become something great, it makes you wonder why you shouldn't buy it. I do have high hopes for this game, as it has already come so far, and i do believe the dev's have some idea as to what they want to add.In short, i think Drift Streets Japan is great game to pick up. Yes, it has bugs and glitches, but what game doesn't? and what game on steam allows to buy drift like this game does? NOTHING.Hense why i recommend this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												Really good game. The drift physics are fun and the multiplayer keeps me entertained. You can tune your cars and even though you may start with a terrible car, you can mod it to be like superman if he was a car. but with these pros there still comes cons. Here is a list for those who can't read poorly formated text:Pros: - Good drift physics (really fun and challenging if you have a faster car, but still fun)- Tunable cars (Really entertaining, and keeps you playing, also the possibilitys are endless)- Many variations in cars- Multiplayer (both lan and online multiplayer)- More features are still to come as this is not a finished gameCons:- Most Quality Graphics?? This is not a game for testing your new Nvidia Titan X. Quake has better graphics.although the only reason why I would say the graphics aren't good is because of the models, they are low poly however the car models are fine, just the map and such. The textures maybe a little too. The graphics are playable and decent though- FPS cap. So we don't have much of a graphics intensive game, which may be good for you guys with not so good specs, but now we have bumped into an fps cap :/ However, this will probably be removed in the future.- People who crowd around multiplayer and crash into you. (Collision atleast in spawn needs to be off)Overall, the game is great, and is like Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas drifting but in one game, and improved in all the ways possible but graphics. Hopefully someone can make an enb mod for this :P

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												I'd recommend this, ONLY if the following apply to you.-You got a few bucks burning a hole in your pocket-You have access to a decent steering wheel (Logitech or better)-And are willing to put some work into sorting your controls (both via wheel & in-game)Things like visuals & audio are always subjective, some might like it, some won't. Music volume can be controlled if you don't like it, engine/exhaust/tire sounds do their part well, and the visuals are a step-above the old NFS-Underground games.If you're looking to play with a controller, wait until full-support is confirmed, or don't bother as it won't work.(long story short, it's both game & controller related, involving trigger command-axis issues)That^ said, I have been enjoying the game with my Logitech G27, set-up to behave like a drifting go-kart of sorts. The game offers some level of 'customization', which devolves to body-color/wheel color combos, and what engine/perfomance-stage parts you choose. There are a fair amount of JDM cars to choose from, and PLENTY of engine-swap choices (my current/favorite combo is a "S240" [a.k.a 240sx] with a ~500hp KA24DE[-T] motor).The physics are arcade-ish, but feel more 'weighed-down' than the NFS2015 "200mph EVERYWHERE" behavior, think the old Underground games with a hint-more realism and weight.Is there $7-worth of content ? - debatable Is there $7-worth of entertainment in the game ? - I'd say yes;Between the solo-mode and the lag-chaos of online, the occasional online tandem (that doesn't end in cars getting launched to space - although still humorous) and the solo practice of finding the sweet-spot for your driving style and the cars perfomance, I could see anyone (who's done the research/effort and didn't just go "GAME BROKE PLZ FIX) enjoying themselves for around 7-hours total.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
												Let me just keep it simple. Pro's + Fun mechanics, takes a while to get used to it, but all in all it's quite enjoyable to just slide.+ Multiplayer has a lot of people on it, tons of people to drag against or drift with and syncro. + $6.99 is modest as ♥♥♥♥ for a game like this, me and all my mates have bought it.+ the turbo spool sounds absolutely amazing, really impressed by it.+ Decent music selection. + Akina is very well made. + GREAT car selection, could use a few more but at this point it's great.+ Very DETAILED cars (besides the fake names which I believe is done for the purpose of avoiding copyright)Con's While I understand the game isn't yet complete, and not anywhere near that stage, these are based on what I see the game needing currently.- Needs more multiplayer options/servers, a drag mode could be cool, and a faceoff mode would be sick.- Needs more paint options for the car, JUST painting the body and rims isn't really enough.- We need somewhere to suggest music for the game, it'd be really sick to hear some music we genuinely listen to whilst drifting.- more maps, maybe a drag strip map for a drag mode or something like that.- Need more part selection for the cars in the game.- A few more vehicles would be cool too, maybe add some muscle to drift with, I'd suggest a BMW M3 (E36), RX8, Ford Mustang, would be mildly hilarious to see a Nissan Fairlady Z, they're ugly but it'd be worth the laugh.- NEED TO FIX the multiplayer sound bug, it's really annoying, I have to play with volume off now because of it. - REMOVE car contact on multiplayer, ANNOYING as ♥♥♥♥ getting hit out of a big drift and losing valuable mula.- Down shifting is really off. - tracks aren't designed for cars really anywhere above 350hp max, bit of a shame. - Breaks need to be fixed, or made customizable, aka let me throw brembo's on my 777hp AE86 so I can stop it lol.At this stage I can say I am extremely happy with the game and every cent i spent on it, it's quite fun, especially linking massive drifts together for money on a private lan, beyond the cons I can happily say I am content with the purchase and I recommend it to anyone into the drift/jdm/customization scene.By the way for anyone complaining about FPS drops, that's all you, I run a beefy set up and I never drop FPS dramatically at all, if you didn't know, this game has a SINGLE dev, you're going to need to be patient and wait for him to find the time to make this game what we all want, I'm sure he'll get to it all with time.

Product received for free
Attention, looks like the devs abandoned the game. Also they are working in a new game on greenlight, so if you bought this game make sure to tell the devs to not left this good proyect behind.Why i do not recommend the game?* Game is empty, there is no objective, or history on the game, not even a race, just a free roam on different maps to get points, and money to waste in cars, or autoparts.* Fov from cars are very bad adjusted, with some cars you just can't see the track well.* 170hp cars are better than 650hp cars, high end racing cars are just unmanageable even changing tunning options.* Multiplayer is just a joke, same as singleplayer, a free roam on different tracks, with no objective, but with people driving on it, also they can troll your drifting points by hiting you (the only fun part of the game).* Bodykits are not for all cars, just some cars can be modified visually.* No stickers, no graphic stuff for the cars, also no pilot / arms on car.* No workshop, they support mods, but button gets you to the forum and you need to install them (not many mods) manually on game folder.* sometimes the game crash, it makes my pc restart two times, also i found some bugs.* Last but not least, there are not many tracks where you can drift, but game has a level editor (never tried it).I really want to like this game, but it needs to be polished, and also finished, it looks like a pre-alpha in it's actual state.

Posted: May 10, 2016
												Alright, i'll be completely honest here.i had a lot of faith in this game when i bought it; the constant updates every day or so, the community etc. until about a month or two after, when updates basically halted to once every three weeks, and with every update that brought content or fixes, another bug would arise. this game is great in it's concept however leaving a game that has it's whole back-story/influence to a russian guy is like letting an indian direct a movie about the american civil war, it makes no sense whatsoever. this game had so much potential for growth however it looks to be just a cash-grab for the dev as he seems to be focused on making another game, and it looks to be that he is pretty much porting stuff from that game and putting it in DSJ.honestly, buy it if you've got the dosh to spare, but don't expect much.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												Awful physics, awful controller support, glitchy multiplayer and not even support for adjusting controller mapping in-game, something that should be taken for granted these days, especially on racing games.If the glitches are fixed, proper controller support added, and fix bugs for multi (and single player) I'd probably buy it again.The concept is great, you have control over camber and offset of the wheels, you can tune the car (not as fine-tuned as possible, but certainly a nice amount) and the multiplayer is in theory where the fun really is. But all the issues take A LOT away from the experience.At this moment, would not recommend this game. 4/10Fix the bugs and it would easily be 8/10 or even 9/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2016
												A quick summary: this is a very rudimentary release about a year of two of development away from being an actual game, and the store page hugely exaggerates the features on offer.Driving: Initially in the only available starter car, the physics seem decent with a fairly natural if exaggerated feel to the drifting. However, as soon as you add power or change to another car it starts to fall apart, with bizarre spins, slides and acceleration in unexpected directions. It feels more like a set of predefined reactions to certain inputs rather than any actual physics simulation, and once you deviate from basic powerslides it breaks.Graphics: The car models are serviceable if rather low-poly (ignoring the large holes in some), but the tracks are very, very basic - some games of the 1990s had more trackside detail. The 'traffic' only exists on one track, and seems to be mainly static cars with extremely low levels of detail.Gameplay: The only gameplay loop that exists is that scoring drift points gives the player a small amount of money per point, which they can use to upgrade then score more points. There is no other gameplay at all.UI: The menus are relatively clean and functional, however simply viewing any performance upgrade seems to immediately purchase it with no confirmation.Audio: The sound effects are passable, the highlight being the turbo sounds. The music is not to my own tastes, but the production is at least okay.Car culture: The choice of cars is well selected for a drifting game. While bodykits are only currently implemented for one car, and there are only 5 choices of wheels, the sheer presence of visual upgrades at least scores a point here. The engine swapping feature is also decent, although the stats for the engines generally bear very little resemblance to the real engines that they are named after.Overall: The game frankly lacks even the most basic levels of polish or even gameplay, and has some jarring inconsistencies in the quality of the art assets. While the developers clearly have put some heart into it and are continuing to work on the game, I wouldn't recommend a purchase now unless it's 90% off and you're happy with 20 minutes or so of just toying around. Hopefully the support keeps coming, and in a year or two this may be worth the budget price.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												This game is very simple and awesome! I'd give it an 8.7/10There aren't many maps, but honestly you don't need more than those that are already in the game! They teach you how to drift  slow and steady and by tuning the car and messing around you can get your drift skills to the max, and make combos that go around 1.000.000. Points :D Soon you'll be drifting like a boss.The bad thing on this game though is, you cannot put on spoilers or change the bodykit a bit. You can however change the color of the rims/body and angle your tires or widen them. I don't mind it not being filled with tuning possiblilities like in Need for Speed, but it could make the game more fun. So customisation would be awesome for an update. Maybe a few more cars (not just JDM) ;)I'm glad finally some racing game put in a Nissan 350z in it ^_^

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												Okay, redoing this review to help some people out if possible.This game is far from finished, is that a bad thing? Absolutely not, this isn't just an android game that's been ported to steam to get the dev some extra cash. The dev(s) are actually updating the game and listening to what people want implemented into the game. There's no stupid microtransactions it just comes down to earning the money yourself to buy cars and upgrade them. It's a great time killer if you want to take a break from one of the flagship racing games just to screw around in an arcadey drift gameThe game is $7... it's fun and it's getting updated frequently. you can't really go wrongPROS: -Detailed car models and reastic engine/turbo sounds -Decent selection of drift/japanese cars that keep being added to the game -Easy to get cash and figure out the controls -Gives you the satisfaction of thinking you're actually decent at racing gamesCONS: -Multiplayer, it's not very good but it definitely has potential  -Not a lot of maps but im sure more will be addedStill better physics than need for speed. 10/10

content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												This game has lots of potential, and I feel like the game is well worth the $10 that you will pay for it. TL;DR at the bottom.Pros:Sounds - the engines in this game sound pretty close to the real life counter parts, and that is important in a game like this! Big Pro!Car Looks - Cars look amazing.Customization - There are some cool options and the devs add more and more.Constant Updates - It is great that the game gets constant updates. The devs are active and so is the community!Cockpit View - It is a great thing to have and if you have a wheel, then you are set!Cons: Glitches - This game is a glitch fest (At the time I am writing this which would be April 4th 2016), I won't lie. Braking downhill is sh$t, hitting the wall or someone else at a high speed glitches your car, and so on. Track Graphics - They are not that good, not a big con but it takes away from the immersion.Car Interior - Not detailed enough, especially when the game has a cockpit view, you would want to have some sort of detail. Though keep in mind this game costs $10, so having a cockpit view is still great!Controller Support - (at the time of writing this) Pure balls. Seriously it is not that good.Car Handling - There are some cars that handle like complete crap, that definitely needs to be fixed.TL;DR Overall, while glitchy, if you are a car enthusiast and you like drifting, turbo flutter, and JDM. Hell ♥♥♥♥ing Yeah get this game!

												This game is alright. Decent amount of cars and a nice amount customization. You can change a lot of settings like camber or if the car is Front wheel drive, rear wheel drive, or all wheel drive. But the thing that gets me so ♥♥♥♥ing mad about this game is that the creators expect you to pay for a game and they expect you to figure out how it works. DO NOT USE A CONTROLLER IN THIS GAME. Steering wheel support for this game is♥♥♥♥♥♥ I used my Thrustmaster T80 and it was♥♥♥♥♥♥ I couldn't steer on drive with my wheel. So when I put unplugged my wheel and tried to use the keyboard... I was ♥♥♥♥ed. You can't reset your keys and you cant input new keys once you set a controller key for them. If a game cant put in a simple reset button, it just shows that the creators don't give two ♥♥♥♥♥ about your gaming experience. This game is not worth your 9 dollars. But if you do feel like buying it, wait for a sale or wait until there are more updates. This game was a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥-1000000000000000000000/10

content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												First off let me say, the game COULD be a lot of fun. The cars are great, the upgrade system is nice, the maps are meh okayyy, but trying to play this game with a keyboard only (especially with all the drifting that requires to constantly change steering directions, releasing and pressing the gas to coordinate clean drifts) makes it a NIGHTMARE to control your car. Like I said this game COULD be a lot of fun, but being restricted to a keyboard in a game where the only way to play it properly would be with a controller, in all honesty, makes it really hard to enjoy. If you implement FULL controller support (xbox 360 joystick, even the d-pad for christs sake) sometime soon, I would gladly change this review from a thumbs down to a thumbs up. But for now, I'm kind of feeling like I just wasted 7 dollars on game that's virtually unplayable.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												Wow.  This game seems super incomplete and hacky and broken.I hope they continue working on it.  I would like a fun ricing game where you can do stupid mods on your car and race some nice mountain tracks, etc.Unfortunately, so far this feels like early alpha. Using a gamepad won't really work.  Partial gamepad support implies that you can play with it, but with limited functionality.  I couldn't even figure out how to make it work.  The configuration is very janky.  I couldn't figure out how to remove a secondary control once it was set.The physics are silly, the cars automatically countersteer, the brakes don't really work,The controls on the keyboard have certain  things hardcoded.  Pressing R puts you at the start of the track, even if you have assigned R to another function.The tracks are very coarse.  The centre line is made up of big linear segments.  The terrain is really repetitive.  It feels like it's all just placeholders.It looks like this game is being actively developed, so maybe it will turn into something some day, but for now it's really not worth buying, and I really don't see how it got such decent reviews.  It should still be early access.

												This game is so horrible that even takes part of IGM worst game of the year.I would say its very close to be at least a lil good one but still worst because every racing game made on Unity is really a pile of junk and no one likes random jumps from MX-5 on mountains drifting, making more than 10k score and randomly jump.I will go with good stuff and bad stuff:Good stuff: -MOUNTAIN AKINA WHICH IS VERY CLOSE TO THE REAL ONE AND EVEN FROM THE ''D''-Lots of cars even Fairlady Z and AE86-Tokyo Highway but it's so lonely that you are going to see a minivan and a ae86 with blue rims-Multiplayer is ok but rare-Many mods you can do on your car like in real lifeBad stuff:- A really bad optimize for older system, SSAO and 8x Antialiasing is only on and off option- You cannot modify game settings to a lower res- The sh**est physics i've ever tried and ProStreet has better than it- You have to drift everyday on Akina to get some cash for your next upgrade- Made by Russians because there is too much Trap music on there- Saucy mods which arent mods- Ugly textures on trees and other misc. stuff- If you want to play on lower resolution on fullscreen, you are stuck to nothing- It's very clean and very boring like MMO games in particularOK STUFF:-AKINA BECAUSE WHY NOT+ if you get some eurobeat, you are going to feel the powerslide- Level editor is very icy because there is nothing but only props install- You can do LAN race/ Host for a serverIf only this game would cost 1.99$ on sale or something but it's very bad and very bad that i recommend playing initial d on ps2 emulator

												A good game, but...The JDM style is respected with a lot of JDM drift cars, and some very good tracks (like the touge).The drift is sometimes very realistic, but there is many problems.This game is not finished. There is too much stupid fails (sometimes your car start to flight !)And the realism is VERY good in some conditions (drift at medium speed), but in slow curves it's too hard to spin, and in high speed curves it's too hard (to drift like in real life).You can tune some cars with 4 differents bodykits, and some others cars you can't !This game is good for Drift fans, but for exemple "CarX Drift Racing" is better in every thing (and it's just an Android App !).

												I'm gonna give this game a 4/10bought this game a year ago feb 5 2016 to be exact. here is the pros and cons about this gamepros:• community is into tandem drifts• good selections of cars (except a eg civic)• some cars have bodykits• adjustable suspension(height, offset, camber, and rims size)• engine modifications with different soundscons:• very slow development• horrible control mapping not even a reset button exist. not for gamepad or racing wheels• no controls adjustment in game you have to restart the game• annoying garage transition effect from clicking anything like changing paint, cars, etc. it hurts my eyes looking at it. at least put some option to remove that effect• needs another camera a higher angle. some cars are big and takes 40% of the screen. or adjustable camera• for a year they haven't added a single rim selection• sometimes throttle gets stuck from revving

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
												For a game that blatantly rips off other games models and textures, has no direction for gameplay other than freeroam drifting or online freeroam drifting and buying cars this game has so much potential and is one of those rare gem games that i will be watching closely.From what a few friends have told me there is alot of regular updates for this game keeping it fresh, there is a very basic level editor built into the game so you can even make your own courses though it would be nice if they allowed more objects and textures to be used in the Editor it is still very user friendly.The only downfall i have noticed with this game so far is that online requires a decent connection or you will D/C after about 30 seconds with no warning, and you can only control master volume levels.The first time you play the game it will seem very badly made hard to control and incredibly frustrating but if you keep at it and find a nice level to practice on (i use drift track 1's big open space at the spawn to practice without fear of bumping into things) until you are comfortable with your car.There is a huge variety of cars of which none are liscenced so the skins are mirrored or emblems are chromed other than that some of the most popular drift cars appear in this game.Hopefully there is more tracks comming soon and i definatly reccomend grabbing this title if you havnt already. 7/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												Game needs a lot of work, the sound of the engines are far too loud and there's no option to change it. Saying the physics are wonky would be like saying that the Atlantic ocean is damp, the cars flip and fly about the track, fall out of bounds and there's no reset other than dropping out of the map and restarting it. It's more like bumper cars than actual racing and drifting, it's not even worth the $5 with it's cumbersome menus and lack of controller support.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
												So I decided to give this game another chance, it isn't any better then when you guys initailly ♥♥♥♥ed it up. Just going to go play Forza Horizon 3, a game that actually works and has good and decent mechanics. Yeah you guys brought some stuff back and removed that one ♥♥♥♥♥♥ idea of an update. Still this is what needs to be fix imo1. fix the breaking mechanics, when I tap my breaks before entering a corner it should not shoot my car off in the opposite direction spinning like a bat out of hell.2. Fix the shifting mechanic plz! Honestly I hate how I have to shift in this game. 3. The handbreak needs to work as it should. I get the feeling none of you working on this game can actually drift or have no real idea as to how drifting works. The handbreak shouldn't cause me to loose speed like it does in this game. 4. It should fully support the use of any controller the player uses. I use an Xbox ONE controller, some may use PS3 controllers and some might have the Steam Controller, and verious other controllers out there. Honestly I love the idea of what this game could be, but you guys seem to lack the skill to bring it to the level it should be at. IF the devs really grind away on fixing EVERYTHING wrong with this game it could become a great rival to Forza Horizon seeing as there is really no Competition to that game. I STILL DON'T RECOMEND THIS GAME. Guys if you have an Xbox ONE I suggest you get Forza Horizon 3 instead of this, if you own a PS3 or PS4 get Grand Tourismo 5 or 6. Cause this game can't even begin to live up to the level those two games have risen to.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												Sure, there aren't many tracks or cars and maybe the physics is a bit wacky, but I believe this game has so much potential, if the developers are willing to add more things into it, like spicing up Multiplayer with races, adding more cars, maybe tweaking the physics, adding singleplayer races, and the list goes on. I'm enjoying the game as it is, despite being in early stages. It's not your average arcade drifter where you can simply flick the wheel and become the next imagining of Takumi Fujiwara. It actually takes a bit of tweaking your car (with modifications and wheel alignment) and practice to get used to it all, which is exactly what I've been looking for.For being a $6.99 game, it's not expected to be perfect, but I believe it is worth it, granted if you can get past the initial aggravation of dealing with the physics. This game certainly has potential to become great despite its flaws or what it lacks and I hope the developers have a lot in store for 2016. In the meantime, I'll be sliding around the mountain in my 240SX, perfecting my drifting.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
												Love Cars? Drifting? Illegal races?  This is your game!I love this game, I lovespeed and cars. I remember when after school I went to arcades to play the classic Daytona with my friends. This is not "Daytona" but a nice version of an illegal racing, in your illegal garage with the chance of putting some stuff in your car.This is a really good game with a lot of options a the garage to set up your engines, cambers, offsets, and, of course, all tunning stuff related! Of course, takes money from your budget. At the beginning, you have to start with a base car. The good news: painting it's free! Then with the money you will be able to change the engine, adding extra HP it's quite nice. Don't forget to check the turbo, adding nitro and many other interesting things. Of course, we can change the body, swap, and rims!Gameplay: I suggest a joystick, but also keyboard helps. You have the LAN option, playing alone or with friends at the Japan highways or multiplayer version, with other people and try to get some money. You have a chat option and summon friends to race or just having fun drifting. You have a lot of things to do.You have two cameras options, third person, and first person, I always like third but both are great.Graphics: Graphics are not bad. We are not talking about GTA V but I really like the work of the artist team. Cars are different, you can personalize colors. Textures are cool too.Music: The best part of it. The sound of the engine is different from first person camera, also the music. And the themes are just great. Enjoy good music for speed? You gonna have it here!Creating new scenarios: I think this is the big one of the game. You can create your own racetrack! I tried, but I have to say you need patience. The editor seems not to be complicated but you need to have some time.Extras: There's no presentation of the game after the "made by unity". You just go to the garage. I suggest to fix that, would be nice to have a good presentation of the game.You can subscribe the forum. You'll get an extra car if you validate your Steam account. Also, many gamers share their scenarios created with the editor and you can download them for free! It's a great community. I loved that.All extras of this games deserve a 3/5. Of course, all games could be better but this one, I loved it.Suit up boys and girls, it's time for speed!

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
												Love Cars? Drifting? Illegal races? This is your game!This game is somewhat the best I've played throughout my years in Steam. I remember when after school I went to arcades to play some class games similar to this with my friends. This time, they've taken the whole experience of having to spend $2 per round at an arcade full of random people constantly watch your skills to your own PC! This is a really great game with a ways you can customize your rides and pimp them out to your dreamed wives in your garages to set up your engines, cambers, offsets, and so on. At the beginning, you have to start with a cocky ride, but as you play along you're bound to get rich and make it rain all over cars. One of the plus side is colour customizations is free, unlike many other games out there, painting would be the thing that eats up your in game money. You're bound to customize every detail just like me, From it's brakes to the very own rims!Though, I strongly suggest using a controller / Joystick but it's compactable with a keyboard helps. You have the LAN option, playing alone or with friends in the Japan highways or multilayer version, with other people as you try to earn some money. You have a chat option and summon friends to race or just having fun drifting. You have a lot of things to do as to compared to others, you can't.You have two camera, third person and first person, I personally prefer a third party view, but different peoples have different perspectives.Graphics aren't bad. We are not talking about GTA V but I personally really like the amount of effort of the artist team as put into the game.I think one of the main attraction of the game is where you can create your own racetrack! I tried, but I have to say you need patience. The editor seems not to be complicated as it seems, But I'm just an impatient player.You can subscribe the forum. You'll get an extra car if you validate your Steam account. Also, many gamers share their scenarios created with the editor and you can download them for free! It's a great community. I loved that.This game deserves a 8/10 rating from me.Suit up boys and girls, it's time for speed!
